FOREWORD
This new NAEB Directory has been designed to make it easier for you to keep
it up to date. You will notice that it is punched for a loose-leaf binder
and that there is extra space left on each sheet. Each month, in the Newsletter,
we will publish any changes in membership (or in addresses, phone numbers, person¬
nel, etc.) that have occurred during the preceding month. This will permit
you to make the necessary changes in your copy of the Directory. Periodically
new sheets will be issued, incorporating the changes published in the Newsletter,
and these can be readily substituted for the out-dated sheet in your loose-leaf
Directory. We believe this new system will allow you to keep your Directory
current and will alleviate the necessity of printing complete new Directories as
often as has been done in the past. YOUR COOPERATION IN HELPING US KEEP THE
DIRECTORY UP TO DATE WILL BE APPRECIATED — PLEASE SEND IN ANY CHANGES AS SOON
AS THEY OCCUR.
This new Directory has been devised to give you more information about the
NAEB membership, and, by referring to the Index below, you should be able to
use it more efficiently than in the past.
Summary of Membership & Analysis of Active Membership 1
Officers, Directors, Consultants and Staff 2

NOTE: (#) An asterisk following the call letters indicates that the station
subscribes to the NAEB Radio Network service.
